titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Travelers Protective Association is a fraternal organization of traveling salesmen and other traveling businessmen. The Association was founded in Chicago in 1882 to serve as a forum for members to meet and discuss the problems and challenges of their mode of business. Today, the Association conducts monthly meetings, engages in a variety of charitable activities, and provides its members with networking opportunities and experience in public speaking and conducting meetings. The Association's headquarters are in St. Louis, Missouri, and it has chapters in Pennsylvania and Indiana.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of minute books of the Travelers Club of Philadelphia (also called the Pennsylvania Division, Travelers Protective Association), 1886-1894. Minutes record the club's routine business conducted at monthly meetings, including reports of committees, changes to the constitution and by-laws, and nominations and resignations of members. The collection also includes a small amount of correspondence, reports, a manuscript list, possibly of dues, written on the back of an tobacco company advertisement illustration, newspaper clippings, and a pamphlet entitled "Manual of the Active Principles of Indigenous and Foreign Medicinal Plants" from B. Keith & Co., New York, 1858.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
